Based on your preferences, here are a few movie recommendations:

1. "To Have and Have Not" (1937): This classic film stars Humphrey Bogart as Harry Morgan, a ruthless rancher who finds himself embroiled in personal scandal.
2. "The Hunting Party" (2007): This political thriller stars Thomas Middleditch as Chris Taylor, a neophyte recruit in Vietnam who finds himself caught in a battle of wills between two sergeants, one good and the other evil.
3. "The Campaign" (2012): This political satire stars Will Ferrell as David Barton, an incumbent Representative embroiled in personal scandal faces a no-holds-barred challenge from a naive newcomer funded by two unscrupulous billionaire lobbyist brothers.
4. "Platoon" (1986): This war drama stars Tom Berenger as Chris Taylor, a neophyte recruit in Vietnam who finds himself caught in a battle of wills between two sergeants, one good and the other evil.
